New Records: Lionel Messi has 109 international goals, second only to Cristiano Ronaldo's 130
Key Match Events: Julián Álvarez scored the opening goal for Argentina in the 22nd minute
Lionel Messi redirected Enzo Fernández's shot to score his first goal of the tournament in the 51st minute
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina fans gathered in Times Square on the eve of the match and filled the streets on Manhattan before heading to MetLife Stadium
Post-Match Reflections: Messi referred to 'last battles', Scaloni and fans hold out hope Argentina and Messi will return to MetLife for the 2026 World Cup final
Miscellaneous Highlights: The crowd of 80,102 was overwhelmingly pro-Argentina, with only a few sections dominated by red-clad Canadian supporters
Canada star Alphonso Davies limped off in the 71st minute after his right leg was caught in a clean challenge with Gonzalo Montiel
